reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects identifiers, personal records, usage data, geolocation data, sensory data, commercial information, and information about habits and mood.

content: Identifiers (e.g., real name, alias, IP address)

reply.analysis: The privacy policy specifies the types of data that the app collects, ranging from identifiers to information about habits and mood.
reply.reference: Categories of personal information we collect which may vary based on the Service being used: Identifiers (e.g., a real name, alias, unique personal identifier, online identifier, IP address, email address, account or other similar identifiers), Personal Records (e.g., name and surname, email address and username) ... Information about habits and mood (i.e. the information that you input on Moodnotes, Window – Intermittent Fasting and Sleepzy). URL: https://thriveport.com/privacypolicy/

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users have the right to object, limit, or restrict the use of their data, request deletion of their data, and even exercise the right to be forgotten in certain circumstances, indicating that users can opt out of data collection or delete data.
reply.reference: Object to, or Limit or Restrict, Use of Data: you can ask us to stop using all or some of your personal information or to limit our use of it; Deletion: in certain circumstances, you can request a right 'to be forgotten' (this is a right to have your information deleted or our use of your data restricted). We will honor such requests unless we have to retain this information to comply with a legal obligation or unless we have an overriding interest to retain it; URL: https://thriveport.com/privacypolicy/

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties under specific circumstances as mentioned in the privacy policy.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares data with third parties under certain lawful grounds and specific circumstances.
reply.reference: Your personal data may be transmitted to trusted and reliable third parties. This happens only when there are lawful grounds for the transmission. We don’t sell your data, including your images, to third parties under any circumstances. The types of third parties to which your data may be transmitted are as follows: Third parties that carry out activities related to our business and operations. Such parties can operate either on our behalf as data processors (for example, IT or storage service providers) or in the event that we carry out a corporate transaction or operation such as a merger, acquisition, reorganization, sale of assets or assignments, and as a part of the associated due diligence. Public, judicial, or police authorities, within the limits established by applicable laws. Other parties as necessary (for example, competent authorities), if we have reason to believe that your actions are inconsistent with our user agreements or policies or that you’ve violated the law, or if it’s necessary to protect our rights, property, and safety or that of our users, the public, or others. Additionally, we may share your personal data if it’s required for the fulfillment of a legal obligation, or if you give us your consent to do so. URL: https://thriveport.com/privacypolicy/

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with third parties such as third-party tracking technologies, Facebook, Pinterest, Snapchat, Google Ads, advisors, new owners in corporate transactions, public, judicial, or police authorities, and other parties as necessary.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions the various third parties with which the app shares data, ranging from tracking technologies to public authorities, depending on specific circumstances.
reply.reference: The app shares data with third parties such as third-party tracking technologies, Facebook, Pinterest, Snapchat, Google Ads, advisors, new owners in corporate transactions, public, judicial, or police authorities, and other parties as necessary. URL: https://thriveport.com/privacypolicy/
